pages.title: about
pages.text: A random fucker. Oh, there you are. This is a static blog by a random fucker from UESTC, who loves play with computer-related gadgets. but lazy to work. He join a mysterious club with an abbr. of CNSS, where many gay who loves cyber security gather together, so he may share some post about it. That’s for now! Bye-ya!

posts.title: Hello World
posts.text: Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub. Quick StartCreate a new post1$ hexo new "My New Post" More info: Writing Run server1$ hexo server More info: Server Generate static files1$ hexo generate More info: Generating Deploy to remote sites1$ hexo deploy More info: Deployment

posts.title: post
posts.text: gdb-peda & pwndbg commonly used commands Breakpoints‘b / break *addr’ or ‘b func’ bp at addr or bp at func ‘tb’ one-time-only breakpoint ‘info b’ view all breakpoints ‘watch *addr’ stop when mem at addr changed. Control & debuggingc continue r run ni step over si step in fini run till func ret return expr assign return value of expr s / stack show stack and registers and disasm bt current stack frame ​ Example 1234#0 0xf7e250d0 in gets () from /usr/lib32/libc.so.6#1 0x080486b3 in main () at ret2text.c:24#2 0xf7dd6b41 in __libc_start_main () from /usr/lib32/libc.so.6#3 0x08048521 in _start () Memorybins show bins vmmap show virtual memory map shellcode generate shellcode context show context contents
